Gaussian rendering

This method draws a normalized Gaussian blob for every localized molecule. The standard deviation of the blobs is equal to their computed, or user-specified localization uncertainty. Contributions from all accepted molecules are plotted together in the final super-resolution image.

The blobs are rendered using a symmetric Gaussian function integrated over the voxel volume. The contribution of one molecule to the voxel intensity at the integer position is computed as

(1)

Here is the position of a molecule, indexes the molecules, is the corresponding lateral localization uncertainty, is the axial localization uncertainty, and is the proportional size of a voxel in the axial direction. Contributions from one molecule are limited to an interval given by a circle with radius of around the molecule position in lateral dimension and by in axial direction.
